cwe_description: The software does not properly handle errors or conditions that can lead to an out-of-memory (OOM) situation. This can occur when the software attempts to allocate memory that exceeds the available resources, resulting in a crash or unexpected behavior.
explanation: The code uses `realloc` to resize buffers (`iconInfo->bitsMask`, `iconInfo->colorTable`, `iconInfo->bitsColor`) based on values read from the stream (`iconInfo->cbBitsMask`, `iconInfo->cbColorTable`, `iconInfo->cbBitsColor`). If a malicious stream provides a very large value for these sizes, `realloc` could allocate a huge amount of memory, leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) attack by exhausting system resources. There is no check to limit the maximum size of these allocations.

cwe_description: The software does not properly handle errors or conditions that can lead to an out-of-memory (OOM) situation. This can occur when the software attempts to allocate more memory than the system can provide, or when memory allocation fails due to other reasons. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by providing input that causes the software to request a large amount of memory, potentially leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.
explanation: The code uses `realloc` to resize buffers (`iconInfo->bitsMask`, `iconInfo->colorTable`, `iconInfo->bitsColor`) based on values read from the stream (`iconInfo->cbBitsMask`, `iconInfo->cbColorTable`, `iconInfo->cbBitsColor`). If the stream is malicious and provides a very large value for these sizes, `realloc` could allocate a huge amount of memory, leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) attack by exhausting system resources. There is no check to limit the maximum size of these allocations.
